Award.AwardTitle: SBIR Phase II: Patent End-To-End (PE2E) Examination
Award.AbstractNarration:
This Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR) is directed to developing Patent End-To-End (PE2E) application examination capabilities that utilize cloud-enabled software services to enable the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) to collaboratively examine patent applications with enhanced validation, search, and office action support, resulting in higher quality and lower pendency. PE2E objectives include support for formalities review, search planning, annotation/collaboration, and office action formulation. The outcome of this investigation would potentially shift the way in which intellectual property is examined; providing examiners with tools to more deeply understand patent applications, collaboratively research prior art, and more easily document their assessments of the application prior art.

The U.S. economy relies heavily and increasingly upon intellectual property, and patents are one currency of this economy. As patents become more significant in the operations and outcome of U.S. businesses, it becomes increasingly important to assure that the patent examination system delivers high quality and timely examinations in order to support the next-generation of innovations. If successfully-deployed the proposed innovation has the potential to make a significant positive impact upon the US patent and trademark landscape.

POR.DRECONTENT:
This Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR) was directed to developing Patent End-To-End (PE2E) application examination capabilities that utilize web-based, cloud-enabled software to enable patent offices to collaboratively examine patent applications with enhanced validation, search, and office action support, resulting in higher quality and lower pendency. PE2E objectives include support for formalities review, search planning, annotation/collaboration, and office action formulation. The project entailed prototyping a set of collaborative patent examination methodologies, some which have never before been implemented on any platform and which required novel cloud-enabled services. The outcome of this investigation may fundamentally shift the way in which intellectual property is examined; providing examiners with tools to more deeply understand patent applications, collaboratively research prior art, and more easily document their assessments of the application vis-a-vis prior art.

The U.S. economy relies heavily and increasingly upon intellectual property, and patents are the currency of this economy. As patents become more significant in the operations and outcome of U.S. businesses, it becomes increasingly important to assure that the patent examination system delivers high quality and timely examinations in order to support the next-generation of innovations. Former USPTO Director David Kappos stated there’s “recognition at very top of [the US Federal] administration that innovation is incredibly important to our country and to the world; that innovation is the only sustainable source of competitive advantage; that the US is an innovation-driven economy; and that innovation creates jobs. And therefore the USPTO, which is…the agency that protects innovation—is a jobs agency.”

Prior to this award, TeamPatent developed a service allowing applicants to prepare patent applications. With this award, TeamPatent leveraged these technologies to provide an end-to-end patent examination service for use by patent offices. This technology was offered to the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO), which instead contracted with various integrators to build a system under its direction. TeamPatent then offered the product to the European Patent Organization, which licensed it and has since regularly commissioned customizations, extensions, and integrations.


Last Modified: 08/27/2015
Modified by: Rocky Kahn
